required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Survival Rate of All Ceramic Restorations Treated With Air-Water-Blasting Protocol
clinical_study.official_title: Long -Term Survival Rate of All Ceramic Restorations Cemented With Air-Water-Blasting Treatment Compared to Control Treatment

lead_sponsor.agency: Università degli Studi 'G. d'Annunzio' Chieti e Pescara

clinical_study.source: Università degli Studi 'G. d'Annunzio' Chieti e Pescara

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates retrospectively the survival rate of all-ceramic restorations, cemented using AWB technique (test) compared to those cemented with conventional technique (control)

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective study on ceramic restorations, placed in the period 2003-2014, will be performed to assess the survival rate of all-ceramic restorations cemented adhesively. The effectiveness of cementation largely depend on the method used. The Air-Water-blasting performed prior to conventional acid-etch of dental tissues offers an increase in bond strength compared to the conventional etching technique.

intervention.description: partial or complete ceramic restorations bonded to dental tissues after WAB and total etching or after total etching

study_pop.textblock: all patients treated for bonded all-ceramic restorations between years 2003-2014

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who received at least one ceramic restoration
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who received feldspathic ceramic restorations

facility.name: Dipartimento di Scienze Mediche Orali e Biotecnologiche

reference.citation: van den Breemer CR, Vinkenborg C, van Pelt H, Edelhoff D, Cune MS. The Clinical Performance of Monolithic Lithium Disilicate Posterior Restorations After 5, 10, and 15 Years: A Retrospective Case Series. Int J Prosthodont. 2017 Jan/Feb;30(1):62-65. doi: 10.11607/ijp.4997.
Beier US, Kapferer I, Dumfahrt H. Clinical long-term evaluation and failure characteristics of 1,335 all-ceramic restorations. Int J Prosthodont. 2012 Jan-Feb;25(1):70-8.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Università degli Studi 'G. d'Annunzio' Chieti e Pescara
